data.text: A Rugged Phone to Use while Bicycle Touring Around the World

What's good rugged phone for crossing continents? My pixel phone just stopped charging from a little rain. I don't want to be stuck in a remote region with a brick. I already have a bike computer, but would still like a phone that can handle dirt and rain.

i woke up in my tent to my galaxy s20 not wanting to charge from moisture getting into the port. it sucked, pissed me off. i had to find one of those charging pads to charge my phone . here to follow and see whats recommended
data.author: Christian Ramos

data.text: Have you thought about an Otterbox or Lifeproof case?
data.author: Adam Kanczula

data.text: which would you recommend? I'm considering getting a new pixel 5 and case. Plan is to cross Africa next year, so really looking for something reliable
data.author: Moinudin Gallotta

data.text: Probably the Lifeproof. A friend of mine swears by them. He's a boater so always in the wet etc.
data.author: Adam Kanczula

data.text: Nokia 8110 â€˜bananaâ€™. Battery last days, dual sim , tethering. Perfect minimal comm device.
data.author: Tim Smith

data.text: Ya but that can't help with route planning. I have an inreach mini for backup comms.
data.author: Moinudin Gallotta

data.text: Also here to follow and see what's recommended. I've had a galaxy S7 and currently have an S8+ and they both refuse to charge if the slightest bit of moisture gets in the charging port so I don't recommend them. They are waterproof though - I've run min under the tap a few times to get salty sweat out of the charging port when the phone has been mounted on the handlebars and I've dripped sweat all over it. It then takes a long time (hours to days) before it will charge through the usb port. A wireless charger has to used. Sorry for the long post which doesn't answer your question. Hope it helps though.
data.author: John Burland

data.text: iPhone with case and screen protector
data.author: John Smith

data.text: I'm very with my blackview, i sticked a quadlock adapter to it's back!
data.author: Xav Belisle

data.text: My Pixel has been to South America 3 times and several tours in the US without problems. I use a Quad Lock case that has a screen protector. I charge it with a Goal Zero solar panel that is connected during the entire riding time.
data.author: Bill Heimann

data.text: I will bring a S22 Ultra, in a Spigen tough armor case, and I will put it in a seatosummit TPU Guide Waterproof Case for Smartphones (or similar). I should be good with all that...
data.author: Paul Mailhiot

data.text: do you think this is any better than the otterbox or other cases recommended here?
data.author: Moinudin Gallotta

data.text: I second to what Adam Kanczula said. Iâ€™ve used otter box defender pro and it will also protect the charging port so no water/moister gets in there.
data.author: Steve S Gordon

data.text: Cheap device, my solution is, protection inside a simple plastic bag.
data.author: John Gero

data.text: you can't use the phone while in the bag though, can you? Although I'd do this now if stuck without a proper case
data.author: Moinudin Gallotta

data.text: To be done in rain or very humid environment, not always. And at night of course ðŸ˜‰
data.author: John Gero

data.text: Hey a decent case for whatever phone you buy
data.author: Tristan James

data.text: I had the only waterproof case available for my pixel 4a, by lanheim. It still got water damage.
data.author: Moinudin Gallotta
